meanings.definition: Make (a bill or other proposal) law.
meanings.sent1: The president enacts new laws to help the country.
meanings.sent2: The government enacts regulations to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The mayor enacts a silly law that everyone must wear a hat on Tuesdays.
meanings.sent4: The teacher enacts strict rules in the classroom to maintain order.
meanings.sent5: The superhero enacts justice by fighting crime and catching villains.

meanings.definition: Perform or act out (a scene or play).
meanings.sent1: The actors enacts a thrilling chase scene on stage.
meanings.sent2: Children love to enact their favorite fairy tales during playtime.
meanings.sent3: The cat enacts a hilarious dance routine to entertain its owner.
meanings.sent4: The students enacts a Shakespearean tragedy with passion and emotion.
meanings.sent5: The dancers enacts a beautiful ballet performance that mesmerizes the audience.
